result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney E Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).  
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Melvin D.  and the co-actor Deshawn Cross.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for school and treatment ONLY.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney E Wright

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges, filed and signed by the Court.  The Privileges previously granted are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.  Copies forwarded to parties.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Pocan Br 26 for review. os

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 33 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 5 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 months. 

The Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for school and treatment ONLY.  
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Melvin D.  and the co-actor Deshawn Cross.  
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  James C Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  James C Griffin for Tyrone St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case calendared for projected guilty plea hearing.    Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, due to the age of the case, Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Louis Epps for Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.   Case in court due to Justice Point violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Projected guilty plea on January 25, 2016 at 8:30 in Branch 26.

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Zachary Wittchow for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug testing.
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Melvin D or Deshawn C.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rodney E Wright in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Rodney E Wright in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Rodney E Wright not in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
